Most of us are aware of the dangers of having our personal computers and other devices hacked. Computers hold a frightening amount of our personal information that is can be easily accessible to cyber hackers. Luckily, there are a few very simple steps one can take to secure his or her computer. 
Passwords 
Whether it is social media, banking, or simply unlocking the computer entirely, almost everything you do on your computer requires a login username and/or password. People might think they are secure as long as they have everything password protected but that is not always the case. Many people still use extremely simple and predictable passwords, like "password1", that hackers can guess immediately. To avoid this, make all the passwords you use on your computer long and complex. This might seem like a hassle but it will seriously enhance your password security. 
Software Updates 
Software updates can seem unnecessary and annoying most of the time, however they can actually help the security on your computer. A lot of software updates usually include fixes to security vulnerabilities. 
Https vs. http 
Many people don't know that the additional letter "s" at the end of "http" in web addresses can block hackers from invading your computer through the Internet. A lot of sites already have "https", but some don't and it is in your best interest to avoid them. "Https" means that your connection to that site is encrypted so no one can see what you're sending or receiving.
